result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryce C Tyrrell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same
Court does not object to transfer of probation to New York

miscConds.notes: Court ordered restitution in the amount of $4598.92 payable to Michael C. and $3127.00 payable to the Milwaukee Co District Attorney's Office; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) and all applicable fees of supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.

No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No contact with Michael C.

Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.
Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department. 
Court advised defenant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rigths are restored.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryce C Tyrrell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: On Petition for Early Discharge from Probation signed and filed.  Copy sent to Probation/Parole and State.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Cimpl
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ x ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment
Letter from defendant seeking early discharge from probation.
Letter in response to defendant's request to terminate probation.
Defendant's pro se request to terminate probation.

Defendant Bryce C Tyrrell in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Bryce C Tyrrell in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS with 78 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the Earned Release program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.  Court does not object to transfer of probation to New York.

  Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 6 MONTHS condition time.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with: Michael C.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $4,598.92 payable to Michael C and $3,127.00 payable to the Milwaukee Co District Attorney's office; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:  
Letters in Support of the Defendant
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Crime Victim Impact Statement received and filed.

Defendant Bryce C Tyrrell in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Bryce C Tyrrell in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Bryce C Tyrrell not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Plea Hearing scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for 09-04-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bryce C Tyrrell in court with attorney Mary Guimont for Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Bryce C Tyrrell in custody.  William Levins for Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Michael C and family; Jennifer K. and family.

Defendant Bryce C Tyrrell in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Defendant Bryce C Tyrrell in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
